intro: Begonia bracteolata, commonly known as the velvet begonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive texture and color. Begonia bracteolata thrives in shaded to partially sunny conditions and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth.
